results.title: Peru: the revolution that never was
results.creator_credit: Peter Tiffin, David Elstein and Thames Television
results.brief_description: Shows the abject poverty and miserable life style still endured by Peruvian peasant farmers, and notes how the changes to the land tenure system brought about by the 1968 revolution have failed to bring any change in the deplorable living standards of the Peruvian peasant farmer. Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.

results.title: Bolivia: the tin mountain
results.creator_credit: Martin Smith, David Elstein and Thames Television
results.brief_description: A moving presentation showing the desperate poverty in the lives of the tin miners of Bolivia. Notes the problems of lack of capital, absentee ownership of the tin mines, market forces and the political system which influence the prices of tin and hence the life style of the miners. Narrated by Jonathan Dimbleby. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Generation on the wind
results.creator_credit: David A. Vassar, Joel Silverman, Samanther Shadd and Windmill Movie Company
results.brief_description: Details the year long construction of a wind generator on the small island of Cutty Hunk off the New England coast by a group of men who apply collective skills to a task new to all of them.

results.title: With Bekus in Nepal
results.creator_credit: Gail Singer, Andrew Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the life style of the people in a village in Nepal by focussing in particular on Bekus, a thirteen year old boy. Highlights the village blacksmith, the mill, a Hindu wedding and village musicians.

results.title: Children of the long-beaked bird
results.creator_credit: Amanda K. Fox, Burton K. Fox, John Hoskyns-Abrahall, Peter F. Davis, Bullfrog Films and Sveriges television
results.brief_description: The lifestyle of American Crow Indians living on reservations and preserving their traditions. In particular, the film follows the daily activities of Dominic Old Elk, the great-grandson of George Armstrong, Custer’s Indian scout. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Amanda K. Fox, Burton K. Fox, John Hoskyns-Abrahall, Peter F. Davis, Bullfrog Films and Sveriges television

results.title: Houses have history
results.creator_credit: Paul Fillinger, George McQuilkin and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Children look at old buildings and their features in and around San Francisco/Sacramento, USA. Examines how a neighbourhood has changed and the growing interest in preserving and renovating old buildings. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Bosustow Entertainment and Churchill Films

video_links.name: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale

results.brief_description: A Grimm’s fairy tale about a humble fisherman who frees a prince from a spell. The fisherman’s wife siezes the opportunity to have all her wishes granted but ends up where she started, thus learning a bitter lesson.

results.title: Comets: time capsules of the solar system
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Media Four Productions and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Animation sequences are combined with live footage to explore the role comets play in contemporary science research about the solar system’s beginnings. Shows how man’s knowledge of comets has evolved from superstitious fear to a growing understanding of their composition and structure.
results.title_for_label: Comets: time capsules of the solar system

results.title: Animal homes. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: A number of different animals, insects such as ants and a spider, various birds, a beady eyed and rather charming mouse, and other larger mammals are shown making and living in their homes. The principal uses to which animals put their homes, safety, shelter, food storage and the raising of young, are reiterated as they are found in various species. The human parallel is drawn by a group of children who run into the house when a storm occurs. Suitable for lower primary level.
